class.name: Word.ListFormat
class.description: Represents the list formatting characteristics of a range.

properties.name: context
properties.description: The request context associated with the object. This connects the add-in's process to the Office host application's process.

properties.name: isSingleList
properties.description: Indicates whether the `ListFormat` object contains a single list.

properties.name: isSingleListTemplate
properties.description: Indicates whether the `ListFormat` object contains a single list template.

properties.name: list
properties.description: Returns a `List` object that represents the first formatted list contained in the `ListFormat` object.

properties.name: listLevelNumber
properties.description: Specifies the list level number for the first paragraph for the `ListFormat` object.

properties.name: listString
properties.description: Gets the string representation of the list value of the first paragraph in the range for the `ListFormat` object.

properties.name: listTemplate
properties.description: Gets the list template associated with the `ListFormat` object.

properties.name: listType
properties.description: Gets the type of the list for the `ListFormat` object.

properties.name: listValue
properties.description: Gets the numeric value of the the first paragraph in the range for the `ListFormat` object.

methods.name: applyBulletDefault
methods.description: Adds bullets and formatting to the paragraphs in the range.

params.name: defaultListBehavior
params.description: Optional. Specifies the default list behavior. Default is `DefaultListBehavior.word97`.

params.name: defaultListBehavior
params.description: Optional. Specifies the default list behavior. Default is `DefaultListBehavior.word97`.

methods.name: applyListTemplateWithLevel
methods.description: Applies a list template with a specific level to the paragraphs in the range.

params.name: options
params.description: Optional. Options for applying the list template, such as whether to continue the previous list or which part of the list to apply the template to.

methods.name: applyNumberDefault
methods.description: Adds numbering and formatting to the paragraphs in the range.

params.name: defaultListBehavior
params.description: Optional. Specifies the default list behavior.

params.name: defaultListBehavior
params.description: Optional. Specifies the default list behavior.

methods.name: applyOutlineNumberDefault
methods.description: Adds outline numbering and formatting to the paragraphs in the range.

params.name: defaultListBehavior
params.description: Optional. Specifies the default list behavior.

params.name: defaultListBehavior
params.description: Optional. Specifies the default list behavior.

methods.name: canContinuePreviousList
methods.description: Determines whether the `ListFormat` object can continue a previous list.

returns.description: A `Continue` value indicating whether continuation is possible.

methods.name: convertNumbersToText
methods.description: Converts numbers in the list to plain text.

params.name: numberType
params.description: Optional. The type of number to convert.

params.name: numberType
params.description: Optional. The type of number to convert.

methods.name: countNumberedItems
methods.description: Counts the numbered items in the list.

params.name: options
params.description: Optional. Options for counting numbered items, such as the type of number and the level to count.

methods.name: listIndent
methods.description: Indents the list by one level.

methods.name: listOutdent
methods.description: Outdents the list by one level.

methods.name: load
methods.description: Queues up a command to load the specified properties of the object. You must call `context.sync()` before reading the properties.

params.name: options
params.description: Provides options for which properties of the object to load.

params.name: propertyNames
params.description: A comma-delimited string or an array of strings that specify the properties to load.

params.name: propertyNamesAndPaths
params.description: `propertyNamesAndPaths.select` is a comma-delimited string that specifies the properties to load, and `propertyNamesAndPaths.expand` is a comma-delimited string that specifies the navigation properties to load.

params.name: numberType
params.description: Optional. The type of number to remove.

params.name: numberType
params.description: Optional. The type of number to remove.

methods.name: set
methods.description: Sets multiple properties of an object at the same time. You can pass either a plain object with the appropriate properties, or another API object of the same type.

params.name: properties
params.description: A JavaScript object with properties that are structured isomorphically to the properties of the object on which the method is called.

params.name: options
params.description: Provides an option to suppress errors if the properties object tries to set any read-only properties.

methods.name: toJSON
methods.description: Overrides the JavaScript `toJSON()` method in order to provide more useful output when an API object is passed to `JSON.stringify()`. (`JSON.stringify`, in turn, calls the `toJSON` method of the object that's passed to it.) Whereas the original `Word.ListFormat` object is an API object, the `toJSON` method returns a plain JavaScript object (typed as `Word.Interfaces.ListFormatData`) that contains shallow copies of any loaded child properties from the original object.

methods.name: track
methods.description: Track the object for automatic adjustment based on surrounding changes in the document. This call is a shorthand for [context.trackedObjects.add(thisObject)](/en-us/javascript/api/office/officeextension.clientrequestcontext#office-officeextension-clientrequestcontext-trackedobjects-member). If you're using this object across `.sync` calls and outside the sequential execution of a ".run" batch, and get an "InvalidObjectPath" error when setting a property or invoking a method on the object, you need to add the object to the tracked object collection when the object was first created. If this object is part of a collection, you should also track the parent collection.

methods.name: untrack
methods.description: Release the memory associated with this object, if it has previously been tracked. This call is shorthand for [context.trackedObjects.remove(thisObject)](/en-us/javascript/api/office/officeextension.clientrequestcontext#office-officeextension-clientrequestcontext-trackedobjects-member). Having many tracked objects slows down the host application, so please remember to free any objects you add, once you're done using them. You'll need to call `context.sync()` before the memory release takes effect.
